text: Hi Simon, thanks, deadlines are going alright. I remember that shot in More Stuff, it's really nice! I like the way the eyes pop out just when the elf gets squashed :slightly_smiling_face: Is that all part of the rig, or did you have to cheat those things yourselves in the animation? Is getting draw-overs from the director quite common, does it happen in TV animation too?

I've been wondering how it is to animate for TV; when I have a shot with a very tight deadline, I can usually get a result that will do the job, but not always one that I'm satisfied with. When you become more experienced and you can animate those 6-8 seconds a day, do you get better at getting straight to the result you want?
May I ask which shows you're working on now? (Unless it's confidential, of course). Do you have a say in the projects you get to do?
